text:
In this video, you’ll see how to create an 
AWS Marketplace future dated private offer.

With this feature, buyers and sellers can
 independently manage the timing of

purchases to improve financial planning 
and streamline the renewal sales cycle.

Future dated agreements, based on accepted 
private offers, enable buyers to easily

pre-book purchases while existing terms 
are ongoing, provide flexible payment

schedules and invoicing to allow buyers to 
pay for purchases at any time, and enable

independent software vendors (ISVs) to authorize 
Channel Partner Private Offer (CPPO) support.

Other key benefits include automated 
notifications about key agreement milestones,

integrated reporting capabilities, and 
accelerated transactions on AWS Marketplace.
Let’s get started.

This is the AWS Marketplace Management 
Portal, where we’re signed in as a seller.
To begin, let’s create a new private offer.

We'll select the ISV and the product 
we want to create the offer for.
Next, we’ll add the buyer’s AWS account ID.

Let’s continue to the next step 
and configure the offer details.
First, we’ll review the offer metadata.

For the buyer targeted offer type, we'll 
select New Offer starting at a future date.

Next, we’ll provide the 
service start and end dates.
Next, we’ll customize the product dimensions.

For the purposes of this demonstration, we’ll 
offer users limited free access to the product.
We can also modify the additional pricing

configuration and end-user 
license agreement if needed.

Next, we’ll specify whether this offer is a 
renewal and provide the offer expiration date.
Now let’s review and create the offer.
The private offer has been created.

Once the buyer accepts the offer, it 
will become a future dated agreement.

You’ve just seen how to create an AWS 
Marketplace future dated private offer.

You can learn more about this topic in
the description and links for this video.
Thanks for watching. Now it’s your turn to try.
